WorkItem.Description:
When trying to create the Chinook Database for the first time (SQL Express only) we get the following error:

Msg 911, Level 16, State 1, Server VM-MCPD\SQLEXPRESS, Line 13
Could not locate entry in sysdatabases for database 'Chinook'. No entry found with that name. Make sure that the name is entered correctly.

The scripts for the other databases do not have this issue.

Workaround:
Edit the Scripts\SqlServer\CreateDB.sql and add the GO command line right after the CREATE DATABASE line:

IF EXISTS (SELECT name FROM master.dbo.sysdatabases WHERE name = N'Chinook') DROP DATABASE [Chinook];
CREATE DATABASE [Chinook];
GO
WorkItem.Summary: Error when creating database for the first time in SQL Server Express
